item.title: Trying Debian Stable for everyday desktop usage
item.description: A few days ago I installed Debian Stable. I’d been using Sparky Linux, which is based on Debian Testing, and was happy with it. The tools it integrates make the life of a desktop user easier when managing the system, I had no issues with it and had a bunch of software available in the repositories. Well, since Sparky is based on Debian, the “bunch of software available in the repositories” part was a given from the start.
